item.title: The pothole is on the PUBLIC FOOTPATH between St Mary's Junior and Infant Schools, 28th September
item.description:
There is a large hole in the public footpath between St Mary's Infant and Junior Schools which has occurred because of water leaking out of an adjacent manhole (the water meter fro one of the Schools). At night its deep enough for someone not to see it and sustain a nasty trip/fall. Its been there for 2-3 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resurfacing finished on Friday but the no parking line is too long and extends beyond dropped kerb. Knock on effect is that we have lost a parking space on the roadside, 28th September
item.description:
72 Naunton lane - the road outside. They took their wall down a couple years ago and it looks like they should have access from the road. However they shouldn’t and this can be proved by the fact that there is no dropped kerb

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Naunton Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Large Quantity recycling ♻️ Materials Dumped, 27th September
item.description:
Resident asks: Could we have more recycling bins to prevent this happening every two weeks with cardboard being blown around the car park and into Cowl Lane ? If this is business waste, please investigate, if this is residential waste, please provide residents with more recycling ♻️ bin capacity. Thank you.🙏

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowl Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
